title: Community-Based Mathematics Service-Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations and real-world problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners perform mathematics education volunteer work at local community institutions, combining online and offline activities in an environment enabling collaboration and resource sharing via personal devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners collaborate with community institutions (libraries, welfare centers, etc.) to complete at least 7 hours of math education volunteer work over 4 weeks.
Learners can design and execute at least three real-life problem-solving workshops using elementary math curricula (fractions, ratios, measurement, etc.).
Learners write and present a project report evaluating the effectiveness of math education based on experiences gained during volunteer work.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
